title: 112_hr3604
content: The "Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act" allows certain Alaska Native veterans to receive land allotments. Section 41 of the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to allow eligible individuals to receive allotments of up to 160 acres of Federal land. Allotments can be selected from vacant lands owned by the United States or lands conveyed to the State of Alaska. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to allow eligible individuals to receive allotments of up to 160 acres of Federal land. Native Corporations can voluntarily relinquish land for allotment and select an equal amount of Federal land in Alaska as replacement. Certain lands are excluded for security reasons. Subsection (a)(3) is repealed, and a person can only receive allotments as provided in paragraph (3). The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to allow eligible individuals to receive allotments of up to 160 acres of Federal land. Subsection (b)(1)(B) is amended for veterans who served between August 5, 1964, and May 7, 1975. If an eligible individual dies before applying for an allotment, an heir can apply on behalf of the deceased veteran. Regulations in effect before subsection (f) are maintained. The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act is amended to allow eligible individuals to receive allotments of up to 160 acres of Federal land. Subsection (f) regulations will be repealed under the Administrative Procedure Act. A new subsection (f) is added for the approval of land allotments within 2 years of the Act's enactment. The Secretary must approve allotment applications within 6 months and notify interested parties. The Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act requires the Secretary to notify interested parties of their right to contest or protest land allotment applications. If no contest is filed, the application will be approved within 2 years. If a contest is filed, the issuance of the certificate of allotment will be delayed until the contest is resolved. Additionally, individuals who made allotment selections before the Act's enactment can withdraw their selection and reselect lands if the original lands were not conveyed to them. The Alaska Native Veterans Land Allotment Equity Act allows individuals to withdraw and reselect lands if the original lands were not conveyed to them before the Act's enactment. The Secretary of the Interior must issue final regulations within 1 year of the Act's enactment to implement the amendments.
